AdministratorRole.description:
Roles that are assigned to administrators.

These roles are relations between users and the application object. The take the
following form in OpenFGA:
```
(user:bob, full, app:virtool)
```
AdministratorRole.title: AdministratorRole

OTUSequence.description:
A sequence nested in an OTU.

It does not include a nested reference field as this is included in the parent OTU.
OTUSequence.title: OTUSequence

Permissions.description: The permissions possessed by a user and group.
Permissions.title: Permissions

SubtractionMinimal.description: Minimal Subtraction model used for websocket messages and resource listings.
SubtractionMinimal.title: SubtractionMinimal

UpdatePermissionsRequest.description: Possible permissions that will be updated for a user and group.
UpdatePermissionsRequest.title: UpdatePermissionsRequest

get.description: Fetches the details for the account associated with the user agent.

patch.description:
Updates the account associated with the user agent.

Provide a ``password`` to update the account password. The ``old_password`` must
also be provided in the request.

The ``email`` address is not currently used, but will be in future releases.

schema.description: Fields for updating a user account.
schema.title: UpdateAccountRequest

delete.description: Deletes all API keys registered for the account associated with the user agent.

get.description: Lists all API keys registered on the account associated with the user agent.

post.description:
Creates a new API key on the account associated with the user agent.

The new key value is returned in the response. **This is the only response
from the server that will ever include the key**.

name.description: a non-unique name for the API key
name.title: Name

permissions.description: an object describing the permissions the new key will have. Any unset permissions will default to false
permissions.title: Permissions

delete.description: Removes an API key by its 'key id'.

get.description:
Fetches the details for an API key registered on the account associated with
the user agent.

patch.description:
Updates the permissions an existing API key registered on the account
associated with the user agent.

permissions.description: a permission update comprising an object keyed by permissions with boolean values
permissions.title: Permissions

post.description:
Logs in using the passed credentials.

This creates a new session for the user with `username`. The session ID and
token are returned in cookies.

remember.description: value determining whether the session will last for 1 month or 1 hour
remember.title: Remember

get.description:
Logs out the user by invalidating the session associated with the user agent. A
new unauthenticated session ID is returned in cookies.

post.description: Resets the password for the account associated with the requesting session.

get.description: Fetches the settings for the account associated with the user agent.

patch.description: Updates the settings of the account associated with the user agent.

schema.description: Fields for updating a user account's settings.

quick_analyze_workflow.description: workflow to use for quick analysis

show_ids.description: show document ids in client where possible
show_ids.title: Show Ids

show_versions.description: show document versions in client where possible
show_versions.title: Show Versions

skip_quick_analyze_dialog.description: don’t show the quick analysis dialog
skip_quick_analyze_dialog.title: Skip Quick Analyze Dialog

schema.title: UpdateSettingsRequest

example.description: Manage who is an administrator and what they can do.

example.description: Manage instance settings and administrative messages.

example.description: Manage users in any space. Delete any space.

example.description:
Provides ability to:
     - Create new spaces even if the `Free Spaces` setting is not enabled.
     - Manage HMMs and common references.
     - View all running jobs.
     - Cancel any job.
example.name: Base

get.description: Returns a paginated list of users.

force_reset.description: Forces a password reset next time the user logs in

primary_group.description: Sets the ID of the user's primary group

schema.description: Used when adding a user as an administrator

role.description: the administrator role for the user

schema.title: UpdateAdministratorRoleRequest

get.description:
Lists analyses based on a search `term`.

The response will only list analyses on which the user agent has read rights.

Downloads analysis data in CSV or XSLX format. The returned format depends on
the extension included in the request path.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an analysis.

get.description: Fetches the details of an analysis.

Downloads a file associated with an analysis. Some workflows retain key files
after the complete.

put.description:
BLASTs a sequence that is part of a NuVs result record. The resulting BLAST data
will be attached to that sequence.

get.description: Lists all user groups. The group IDs and names are included in the response.

post.description:
Creates a new group with the given name.

The ``group_id`` parameter is deprecated and will no longer be accepted in a
future major release. For now, ``group_id`` will be used as ``name`` if it is
provided.

schema.description: A schema for requests to create groups.
schema.title: CreateGroupRequest

delete.description: Deletes a group by its 'group id'.

get.description:
Fetches the complete representation of a single user group including its
permissions.

patch.description:
Updates a group's name or permissions.

Permissions that are not included in the ``permissions`` object will retain
their previous setting.

schema.description: Used when updating permissions and/or group `name`.

permissions.description: a permission update comprising an object keyed by permissions with boolean values
permissions.title: Permissions

schema.title: UpdateGroupRequest

get.description: Returns a list of change documents.

delete.description:
Removes the change document with the given ``change_id`` and
any subsequent changes.

get.description: Fetches a specific change document by its ``change_id``.

Lists profile hidden Markov model (HMM) annotations that are used in Virtool for
novel virus prediction.

Providing a search term will return HMMs with full or partial matches in the
`names` attribute.

Each HMM annotation is generated from numerous public viral protein sequences.
The top three most common names in the protein records are combined into the
`names` attribute.

Lists the installation status of the HMM data. Contains the following
fields:

| Field      | Type          | Description                                               |
| :--------- | :------------ | :-------------------------------------------------------- |
| `errors`   | array[string] | An array of any errors in the HMM data                    |
| `installed`| object        | A description of the currently installed HMM release      |
| `task.id`  | integer       | The `id` the task responsible for installing the HMM data |
| `release`  | object        | A description of the latest available release             |

**Installed HMM data cannot currently be updated**.
Fetches the latest release for the HMM data.
Lists all updates applied to the HMM collection.

post.description: Installs the latest official HMM database from GitHub.

get.description: Fetches the details for an HMM annotation.
Lists all existing indexes.

schema.description: Return only indexes that are ready for use in analysis.
schema.title: ready

get.description: Fetches the details for an index.
Downloads files relating to a given index.
Lists history changes for a specific index.
Fetches the active administrative instance message.

patch.description: Updates the existing active administrative instance message.

put.description: Creates a new administrative instance message.

get.description:
Lists jobs on the instance.

Jobs can be filtered by their current ``state`` by providing desired states as
query parameters.

**Archived jobs are not currently returned from the API**.

patch.description: Sets the archived field on job documents.

get.description: Fetches the details for a job.

status.step_description: Map sample reads to reference OTUs and discard.
Map remaining reads to the subtraction and discard.
Find ORFs in the assembled contigs.
Search for viral motifs in ORF translations.

put.description: Cancels a job using its 'job id'.

status.step_description: Map sample reads to reference OTUs and discard.
Map remaining reads to the subtraction and discard.
Find ORFs in the assembled contigs.
Search for viral motifs in ORF translations.

get.description:
Fetches the latest remote reference update from GitHub.

Also updates the reference document. This is the only way of doing so without
waiting for an automatic refresh every 10 minutes.

example.body:
#### Changed
- add new isolates to Cucurbit chlorotic yellows virus
example.name: v0.1.2

get.description: Lists all updates made to the reference.

example.body:
#### Fixed
- fixed uploading to GitHub releases in `.travis.yml`
example.name: v0.1.1

post.description: Updates the reference to the last version of the linked remote reference.

example.body:
The release consists of a gzipped JSON file containing:

- a `data_type` field with value _genome_
- an `organism` field with value _virus_
- the `version` name (eg. *v0.2.0*)
- a timestamp with the key `created_at`
- virus data compatible for import into Virtool v2.0.0+

Scripts have been updated to follow upcoming convention changes in Virtool v3.0.0.
example.name: v0.3.0

get.description:
Lists subtractions by their `name` or `nickname` by providing a `term` as a
query parameter. Partial matches are supported.

Supports pagination unless the `short` query parameter is set. In this case, an
array of objects containing the `id` and `name` of every subtraction is
returned.

post.description:
Creates a new subtraction.

A job is started to build the data necessary to make the subtraction usable in
analyses. The subtraction is usable when the `ready` property is `true`.

schema.description: Used for creating a new Subtraction.

name.description: A unique name for the host (eg. Arabidopsis)
name.title: Name

upload_id.description: The unique id of the file
upload_id.title: Upload Id

name.title: Name

schema.description: Complete Subtraction model.

field ``file`` containing the file data.

A file ``name`` and ``type`` must be included in the query string.

SpaceProjectRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all projects in the space.
SpaceProjectRole.title: SpaceProjectRole

SpaceReferenceRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all references in the space.
SpaceReferenceRole.title: SpaceReferenceRole

SpaceRole.description:
Roles that are bestowed to users in a space.

Un-prefixed base roles are ones that apply to the space directly. Only one can be
selected at a time.

Prefixed base roles are ones that apply to specific resource types in the space.
Only one base role per resource type can be selected at a time.
SpaceRole.title: SpaceRole

SpaceSampleRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all samples in the space.
SpaceSampleRole.title: SpaceSampleRole

SpaceSubtractionRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all subtractions in the space.
SpaceSubtractionRole.title: SpaceSubtractionRole

SpaceUploadRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all uploads in the space.
SpaceUploadRole.title: SpaceUploadRole

put.description: Adds a role for a user.

SpaceProjectRole.title: SpaceProjectRole

SpaceReferenceRole.description: Roles that control space member access to all references in the space.

Un-prefixed base roles are ones that apply to the space directly. Only one can be
selected at a time.

Prefixed base roles are ones that apply to specific resource types in the space.
Only one base role per resource type can be selected at a time.

SpaceSampleRole.title: SpaceSampleRole
